Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, food is ok”
Reviews.Author: blackcaps
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is good, located near to many indian restaurants. hotel rooms are good and clean. hotel food is not good enough, especially breakfast which contains very less amount of varieties of food item, also many items gets repeated evey alternate days. Staff is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful sevice”
Reviews.Author: Ian F
Reviews.Content: There was some confusion with the reservation with this hotel as we had made a reservation a Highland City Hotel but the reservation was at Howard Johnson Hotel. Having said that this hotel was great. The hotel is in the older part of Dubai which is not a problem. There are some good eating places nearby which is a great help. We arrived in Dubai at 5.30am not expecting to have a room available until 2.00pm. The hotel made the room available at 8.30am which after a long flight from Australia was greatly appreciated. Also they provide breakfast which was also not expected. The rooms at the hotel are very good with a great breakfast provided. The hotel can also organise a tour of Dubai directly from the hotel. There is also transport available from and to the airport but you have book before arriving.

Reviews.Title: “what a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aisaaee
Reviews.Content: i stayed there on my own,and the place was clean and service was prompt,the reception staff was very friendly and so do the house keeping,stayed there for 5 nights and never had any noise complain as some members did,only thing was the reception manager as he was thinking in his mind he is something above other staff as he wasn't paying attention to guests, been to the club on 1st floor nice and well controlled. nice Indian breakfast,

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 Hotel. Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Shalinagrawal
Reviews.Content: Hi, Would like to give a detailed review about this Hotel. The biggest negative before deciding on this hotel was the reviews down that the music played by DJ was too loud. But there was no DJ music disturbing even on second floor (were our room was). Not even on weekends! Not even for a minute! The sleep was quite silent. The check-in time of hotel is 2.00 p.m. & check out is 12.00 p.m. We expected that being check-out time 12, we would get room by atleast 12.30 or utmost 1.00. We reached hotel by 12.30 p.m. As we reached, we were told that the they could give room only by 2.00. So we went out for Lunch. We came @ 2.05 and asked that whether room is free to check-in now. The receiptionist looked at the Watch and said that now she can give the room. SHE WAS VERY RUDE IN TALKS TO EVERYONE. No Flexibitlity at all. At check-out also, she called up at 11.00 and asked that when are we checking out (though the check-out is at 12) Regarding Hotel: The hotel & rooms are very neat & clean. Location of the hotel is okay though there are much better hotels on the same road in terms of location. One has to walk around 15-20 mts to find a good resturant. Burjuman Mall & Metro stations is also far off and not at walking distance (though on same road). The bus stops are just 2 minutes from the hotel. Breakfast is just ok. Lot of options for Non-vegetarian but very less for Veg. It was repeat on almost all days. Jain breakfast available on request. They would give only one hot breakfast for Jain Veg. Rest one has to choose from the spread. Overall it was filling to keep you going till late afternoon. Overall I would recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good from the outside, rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: chindelly
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was not very pleasant, hot food only luke warm. Nightclubs downstairs playing thumping music and disrupting sleep, I heard the bass from the 7th floor! Laundry service, I had to call them to find out where my laundry was 2 days after handing it in. Not much decent in walking distanceof hotel, restaurant choices limited. I heard a lot of people complaining at reception at various things. The fitness centre was poorly equipped with outdated equipment

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place - but noisy music”
Reviews.Author: Jacob57
Reviews.Content: Most of the other reviews are dead on - but breakfast is not that bad. The problem with loud musik from the night club in the hotel is well known - also by the hotel itself. In my room on the 4th floor (night club is on the 1st floor) the music was only hearable when I went to sleep, but if you are boteherd by this, then do as I did: use earplugs. Worked for me! The breakfast mentioned in other reviews is a buffet with simple and cheap food, but OK to keep you going until midday. Just don't compare with high class hotels. Than you will be fine. I appreciated the top floor and roof: large area for sun bathing, a small pool and a great view (see photos taken from there). Inside is a well equipped and well functioning gym with everything to keep you fit. Two steam rooms also (men+women), good facilities, a guy handling you towels and selling drinks. I never tried the hotel restaurants, plenty of places in the area. I did try the hotels city sightseeing tour (cost 150.- for 4 hours), and this was very good, skilled guide and good places. Also flexible to the passengers whishes (small minibus for 8 visitors). Good Wifi (but costy at 40.- for 24 hours), buy an access code in reception.

Reviews.Title: “A value for money 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: Ramkishore
Reviews.Content: Located in Bur Dubai, this is one of the many 3 star hotels along the stretch of Khaleed Bin Waleed Road. The closest Bus Stand is less than 5 minutes away (by walk - Al Ghubaiba Bus Stn) and the Metro (Rashidiya Line) is approx 2-3 kms away! We chose to stay at Highland City based on the reviews here and weren't disappointed one bit! The rooms and the bathrooms were very clean and most of the staff were very courteous and helpful. Yes, the continental breakfast is not all that great but we were surprised that they also had an Indian spread for breakfast for the entire period of our stay, not sure if this is available throughout the year though. Like the other travelers who have reviewed this hotel mentioned, there is quite a bit of noise from the hotel's Night Club located on the Mezzanine floor, None of us lost sleep over the noise, probably because our rooms were on the 4th floor but am sure it will be a major inconvenience to guests allotted lower floor rooms! I would suggest you specifically ask for a room on the higher floor to stay away from this noise! For the Indian/Vegetarian specific travelers, this hotel is operated by the Sarovar group of hotels who are an established brand in India, most of the staff are Indians and their hospitality is very good! There are also quite a few Indian restaurants around this hotel, the closest being Rajdhani, just a few hundred meters away. WIFI Internet is available but on a chargeable basis, I paid 40 Dirhams for 24 hours of usage with a 3 day validity, fair price! This hotel is also equipped with a pool located on the top floor! Overall, we enjoyed our stay and had absolutely no problems, I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfladipo
Reviews.Content: Much better than we expected, the rooms were big and well furnished with a flat screen and we got an absolutely good deal with expedia compared to their rack rates. The receptionist was not too friendly but the rooms made up for it. The train station is 10 dhrs away but apart from that, I would definatel definately stay there again, in fact i have recommended it to many other friends and clients

Reviews.Title: “DECENT PROPERTY WITH BAD BREAKFAST & NOISY NIGHt CLUB”
Reviews.Author: Murlisub
Reviews.Content: It is located in the center of Dubai shopping area.Everything is close by with in walking distance. The rooms are comfortable with good room service. The breakfast spread is bad. Same stuff everyday and a nightmare for veggies as Non-veg food stuffs are clubbed together with veg food. Same fruits everyday. The hotel's nightclub is noisy and is a notorious pick up point.

Reviews.Title: “Was glad my family and I stayed at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stan300910
Reviews.Content: I travellled with my wife and 3 young children and our stay was good. The hotel staff were warm and accomodationg. Our room (612 - mini suite) was excellent for our accomodation requiremnents. Would i return to this hotel when next in Dubai? YES.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel if looking budget deals”
Reviews.Author: forpriyank
Reviews.Content: not bad a hotel.. music from clubs is too loud late night.. not a decent crowd.. recomended for single male travelers .. guess they had professional girls around as well..

Reviews.Title: “Located in Heart of Dubai with great accessibility”
Reviews.Author: Fals
Reviews.Content: I had been to Dubai the very first time along with my Family in January 2009 and stayed at " The Highland Hotel". It was a fabulous vacation for one week we had in Dubai. dubai known for multicultural people, great respect to tourists of all countries, world famous Malls, Deserts and The Burj Khalifa. The Highland Hotel is located in Bur Dubai, one of the famous and most busy area of Dubai.Since we are Indians we enjoyed thegreat accessibility to Indian Restaurants,Shopping Malls, Carrefour, Dubai Creek, Dubai Museum, Starbucks,Sheikh Zayed Road and Commercial Banks. The hotel in itself has good food in different restaurants and the buzzling Nightlife at the Dance Club.The staff were very courteous for all our querier pertaining right from travel, food to City information. They went the extra mile to give us more information aboud Dubai for us to enjoy our holidays. Today after one year I am so happily married and live just opposite to the Highland Hotel along with my husband and cherish all the memories I had during my holidays in Dubai. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wish to travel to one of the best city in the world- DUBAI.

Reviews.Title: “NOT EXPECTED THIS TYPE OF BAD BEHAVIOUR OF MANAGER IN DUBAI”
Reviews.Author: sikharesh
Reviews.Content: Most of the staffs are nice, but some serious problem with TOP management (Mr GEET of SRILANKA) ! They play and patronise very LOUD music in TWO Loungebar/Disco everyday 9pm-3am. They dont listen to anyone , and also told me noone objected for that. So, if you can adjust with that MUSIC fine, else you have to form a MORCHA for protest there! They wont listen to you even after that perhaps. I am reffering this issue to Dubai Govt. also as this hotel spoiled my holiday last week. Very surprising, how Emirates Air have tie up with this kind of hotel. It was heavy rush in the Dubai for DSF, and I failed to get any other reasonable accomodation there after 1st night. I was even ready to take a loss of 3 nights payment made to the hotel in package. SO, people who can sleep in DISC can go - others better avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: lwiz2003
Reviews.Content: Because my husband was traveling with a non-US, non-European passport, Dubai immigration authorities forced us to show confirmation of a hotel that they chose-we paid for this at the airport. They told us this was a quiet family hotel. It was quite the opposite. There were several obvious prostitutes there-heard their conversation in the elevator and the porter confirmed this. The discoteque pounding of the music was very loud to 4 AM. Couldn't sleep at all. Looks like there is a kickback scheme with this policy of them assigning you to a hotel. We were there only in transit -overnight stay before going to another country. We had stayed at the Eureka hotel before which was smaller, but quiet and quite decent. The Highland hotel looked remodeled and clean, and the reception was pleasant, but I would NOT recommend the Highland hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so expensive hotel in Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: sq7700
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Dubai after a night flight from Paris around 9:00 am, and as the metro was under contruction we had to take a taxi. Therefore we arrived at the hotel pretty early, around 10:00 am. We were told that we had to wait for check in but asked if there was no chance of getting a room anyway. After 1 minute we were given a room at the 1st floor. The room was OK, nothing to complain about at all (expect for the view - but who cares, we weren't in Dubai just to stare out of our hotel's window!). Clean, nice tv, nice beds, fresh toilet etc. We decided not to stay in the hotel for a long time and walk around the hotel to see whether it was a good location or not. After spending one week there I'd say that it's a pretty good location (if you take the price into consideration). Bur Dubai and Deira really felt like the old Dubai which was kind of cool. The creek was around 10 minutes of walking from the hotel, just perfect. Bur Juman shopping center (and today also a metro station) was around 20 minutes down the street. Al Ghubaiba bus station (where bus number 8 and 8A depart, which are really useful if you want to get to Jumeirah Beach Park or Burj Dubai for 2 AED) is very close as well. The hotel had its own rooftop pool plus a jacuzzi, nothing special but we used it a few times actually. From the roof you were able to see the famous Dubai skyline plus Burj Dubai. Reception staff was good, help us with the booking of the dessert safari. They also helped us with airport transfer for our departure (which could be needed since it's not always very easy to get a taxi in the street). There was nothing special about the breakfast, however the courses changed a few times which was nice. The Highland Dubai is an overall pretty good deal if you don't want to spend a fortune while in Dubai and proves that you don't have to be among the richest to have a good time in the city.

Reviews.Title: “nice, cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: arounddworld29
Reviews.Content: amazing view of port rasheed from the rooms, amazing indian resturant " kebab korner" it has a philipino disc as well as indian disc too!!!!! I am sure you gonna love the hotel and your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not So Appealing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhsnice
Reviews.Content: This hotel has restaurant but during my time of accommodation, morning breakfast was offered in a Banquet Hall in spite of the fact that I was not travelling in any group. Banquet Hall is so small that it get occupied so fast and we've to wait for a long. Secondly, hotel room that was allotted to me, didn't have any safe lockers which is necessary for all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: DavidWright2
Reviews.Content: We searched the internet for hotels in Dubai finding this one based on price, location and amenities as described on the website, "Hotels-n-Europe.com". We traveled 18 hours by air with a taxi to the hotel, only to find they didn't have a room for us and could not find our reservation. We presented our copy of the confirmation and it was a complete surprise to them. All they were willing to give us was a smoking twin. We left immediately and went to the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Uninteresting Location”
Reviews.Author: MandDBordeaux
Reviews.Content: The Highland Hotel was a refuge from the long distance travel and heat of Dubai (but then again anywhere with air-con would have been good). We were flying from France to Australia and decided to break the trip up by stopping over night in Dubai. We arranged a shuttle from the airport to the hotel and we think in the long run this may be easier rather than fighting for a cab. The location of the hotel isn't all that interesting as you find yourself near the docks of Dubai and no real tourist attractions. Although everything can be reached by a taxi ride of around 15-20mins, heading out on foot means you will no doubt be breathing in a lot of the pollution that dubai has to offer. The hotel is modern and clean and the rooms are well dressed and modern. The bed was comfortable and the shower had good pressure. The breakfast of which we bought was expensive but seeing there didn't seem to be many other options in the area it was easier to stay in and pay the extra. It was buffet style with everything from Omlettes and Juices to Curry and Naan for breaky. One thing we didn't like was the fact that the hotel has a dico / live concert room in their basment. Normally this wouldn't worry us but the fact we were flying half way around the world and had to be awake at 6.30am made it a little annoying. When I phoned reception and asked them what time the music would finish she politetly told me that they would be finishing at 2am. Considering we were on the 4th floor and could still feel the bass I wonder if they realise how this effects the stay of their guests. All in all the hotel is nice but over priced for the location and the breakfast, still we were comfortable and managed to get some good sleep, eat well and had a good sleep (in the afternoon).

Reviews.Title: “Highland ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: greenshade
Reviews.Content: I arrived to this hotel with 10 other people (family/extended family) all aged 5-37. I didnt have much to do with the hotel staff and my mum paid for me to stay. She hated the hotel so much, she didnt like the staff which were mostly immigrants from India and the cleaners were mostly from the Philipines (they were lovely). The Hotel: The rooms are ok..theres a small fridge, a tv with some good channels, a really nice bathroom with towels/shampoos etc and the beds are comfortable. But on the down side their sea view isnt great, you can barely see the sea..unless you look through gaps of buildings in the distance. The hotel has a nightclub and a restaraunt which is also a sort of nightclub so there loud music in the night, I could hear them but it wasnt so bad that you couldnt sleep over it. The staff were a bit dodgy and yes you really do have to keep your luggage padlocked. The hotel has a really nice swimming pool on the roof and also a little jacuzzi which the kids really enjoyed. There was a life guard and he was a pervert. This may sound a little horrible but with most the staff being immigrants from India expect Indian style service not Dubai style service. The hotel has a small sauna which no one really used (Apart from my sister and cousin) and also a gym that no one used but it looked nice. They also have high speed internet connection in a computer room which doesnt cost a great deal of money to use. No one really used the swimming pool and there wasnt many tourists at the hotel, just what seemed like immigrants from mostly India. The Location: Taxis are very easy to catch and you can take them to nearby restaurants, some of which are fantastic. This hotel is in a very immigrant area, its run down looking and not the cleanest. In the evening the outside of the hotel is packed out with Pakistanis who will perve on you and believe me, nothing will stop them. This really got me angry, there was just no respect for women from these people. The only reason im mentioning where the immigrants were from is so you can have a better understanding and idea of how it was, especially if youve been to Pakistan (which I have) and India (which I might). On the plus side the taxi ride to the beach (a gorgeous beach) isnt very far and neither is Dubai zoo which when I went, had lion cubs. Overall the location was more like India than Dubai but youre just a taxi ride away from the real Dubai. I wouldnt recommend lone female travelers but a bunch of guys on a budget would probably love it. Oh and they did do breakfast: the chef made really nice omlettes and breakfasts were over-all nice but make sure you get there early or you wont have anywhere to sit. For lunch, you can take a taxi to mcdonalds or Pizza hut (the pizza hut staff were lovely) which arent too far away. I recommend Pizza hut especially if youre travelling with children, its a good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “awful - loud thumping music and dubious nighttime activity”
Reviews.Author: freshgirl72
Reviews.Content: Stayed this week for a stopover between India and the UK- arrived at 0100 to be greeted by loud thumping music from the nightclub on the ground floor which was still shaking the walls of the bedroom and bed on the 6th floor at 0300. There were clearly transactions taking place in the lobby with rooms being hired out for very short time periods and I have never felt more uncomfortable when on checking out later, females were being paid openly in the lobby for clearly services delivered in the night- horrid experience.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced hotel with none facilties available as they say”
Reviews.Author: PurpleAngelLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel could not find my reservation when i got there, my Partner was already in the room but they could not locate any info! Rooms quite small, no slippers or bathrobes available as they say, around 15 min walk from Meena Bazaar. Hotel has three clubs/ bar/ pub there is a fee to go in the club, alcohol far too expensive, music far too loud when you want to sleep. Breakfast is very limited, no variety! Swimming pool was under maintenence, we were not told. Your better off to pay the extra £50 for something decent and more local, friendly!

Reviews.Title: “From the Highland's to the Highland”
Reviews.Author: ExiledinAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, found the staff pleasant and courteous. The room was very good, clean and tidy, as you would expect. The hotel location in Bur Dubai was ok, handy for the bus station (cheaper to get around, only 2 Dirhams one way approx 32p to get to Jumeira Beach & the Burj Al Arab hotel). The location is handy as there are a few hotel bars in the area. I would not recommend it for families with kids as apart from the hotel pool on the 15th floor not a lot of beach for them to play on. This hotel, I would recommend as a good choice for a few days stopover or a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: iwannagoonhols
Reviews.Content: Booking through expedia was a complete nightmare with them leaving off return transfers! Resulted in having to make numerous costly calls to resolve this - very stressful considering is was only a 3 night trip!! We were a party of 2 yet the filipino receptionist was adamant we had booked 2 rooms for 4 people even after showing our booking papers kept us waiting in reception for more than half an hour on arrival! Then we were locked out our rooms and asked to move right away when they realised (2 days later!!!) that they had made a mistake.We were exhausted after returning to the hotel at 11pm after a whole day of business meetings and refused to be moved that night and had to move on the last day instead which really messed up our plans! I have never stayed in a place with such incompetent reception staff. The disco was beyond sleezy as is the most of bur dubai. It was more like a strip joint with all male audience watching half naked women lined up and dancing for them - disgusting!!! Avoid the place at all costs !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: DohaShredder
Reviews.Content: I recommed the Highland. I would say the good points outweight the bad ones. Lets start with the good things. The rooms are very nice, good design; big and clean. The bathroom is also clean. The location is safe and its not far from the creek. And the price; at 150 US Dollars per night for a double; you won't find something of this quality in Bur Dubai for less. AS for the bad things. Despite the good location; it isn't that easy to catch a taxi. Inside the hotel; the reception isn't very inviting; and the check-in is slow. In the rooms, be careful; u get charged for using the tea and coffee sachets. AND most importantly; demand a room on a high floor. The hotel has a nightclub, we stayed on the third floor; but could still hear some faint thumping

Reviews.Title: “Never Go Back !!!”
Reviews.Author: alexkingsix
Reviews.Content: I visited Dubai with family in the month of March 2008 and stayed at Hotel Highland. They gave us four rooms on different floor regardless of my request a week before in advance. I read reviews and asked in advance for a room higher up and I was given a room on the third floor which was still very noisy. The staffs (especially at reception desk) were very rude. I requested extra bed and they gave us one of most disgusting and greasy bed I have ever seen. I would rather sleep on the floor then on that bed. The breakfast was the worst we have ever had. Highland Hotel is not deserved even one star. Please search more and choose other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ICT_Guy
Reviews.Content: Hi, I visited Dubai with family in the month of Feb 2008 and stayed at Hotel Highland. Given below is the portion from my travel blog which relates to this hotel. ".....When we reached hotel, we were welcomed by friendly staff there. After some waiting (our check in was at noon), we were allocated room some three hours before our normal check in time. Hotel seems to be a good one from outside though the reception and lobby area is undergoing renovation works. But that is not much of inconvenience as such. We were given room on 4th floor. When we reached our room, we found it very neat and clean. A very nice accommodation by 3 star standards. Toilets were clean, equipped with tub, 24 hour running hot and cold water. Rooms are with TV having satellite connections. There was a hotspot internet facility in the hotel but I found the rates very expensive (10 AED for an hour and 40 AED for the day). I didn’t opted for it. Making international calls from hotel too was very expensive. Soon I found an alternative from it in form of calling cards which you can buy from any shops which can be found just next to hotel. There cards can be used in any of the commonly found pay phone booths on the streets. As we had a long flight and my kid was tired, we decided and then to explore the next option....." In nutshell, highly recommended for stay in Dubai. This is a good hotel for family, very centrally located and nicley priced. Hope this will be of help for others.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Cheerful and Clean”
Reviews.Author: sutski
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotels.com, breakfast was included although I didn't make it down in time on any of my 4 days...Blame that on the nightclub "Rock City" downstairs and of course the girls...The nightly live music was classic rock and was headbangingly good. I would concur that this is an excellent place for singles, I had a riot ;o) However be aware as a single person booking, you cannot have 2 people staying in your room so a small charge is made if you want to increase the number of occupants in your room, even if only temporarily ;o) Food was middling in the "family" Indian restaurant downstairs, but the dancing girls and live music made up for it, despite it being played so loud the waiter could not make out what I wanted and brought something totally not what I ordered...It was still ok though. Nice roof top Jacuzzi and small pool too. I took a junior suite and it was nice and big with a smart new bathroom and a flat screen TV too. All in all, a very nice stay, the staff were excellent to. I would recommend here if you want a lively place that is way better value than the big chain hotels. Despite it being not ideally located, taxis are everywhere and cost next to nothing. Good Chinese restaurant and an Irish pub just down the road within easy walking distance, but prob better off grabbing a cab and heading to the Marina which is about 20mins and £5.00 in a taxi. Best bars I found there were The Barasti and Bhudda, both in hotels and Bhudda is where the money and the famous go. Dubai Desert Creek Golf Club does a cracking full English breakfast too by the way !

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay in dubai highley recemmended”
Reviews.Author: heropakistani786
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel since 2004 and just love the service that is proveded the friendly staff room service is there when you need it 24/7

Reviews.Title: “Respected place.”
Reviews.Author: t5saj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 5th floor any lower and its loud music till 3am from night club down stairs! Good service clean place. Just ask for 4th floor on wards!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Pleasent Stay”
Reviews.Author: reena_b
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the 8th dec 2007 until 11th dec 2007. I was a single female traveller abit worried about staying alone, if though i heard Dubai was safe. It was fantastic, I checked in without any problems, porter brought my suitcases up for me, even ripped off all the security tags for me :P The manager Mahesh Kumar was lovely, He showed me how the AC and all the amenities worked in the rrom. In the hotel lobby is an Excursion company called Suncity Tours, who have amazing excursions going on for a reasonable price. They are also very helpful and polite. I didn't really wake up to have breakfast while I was there, but one morning I did and it was a buffet style breaky with a large variety of dishes, warm and cold. In the room is a food menu from the Restaurant downstairs, they have a good variety of dinners and lunches, Very cheap too, ( try the chilli Chicken) The hotel DOES have 3 clubs however I was on the 3rd floor, but by the time I came in from a hard day travelling out in the sun, I was too tired to acknowledge the club and the noise and use to fall straight to sleep, I actually found it difficult to get myself out in the morning. Very close by to Deira, gold souk, spice market, mina bazzar, carefour, boat creeks. Jumerih beach is about 10-15mins away in taxi not expensive at all. Airport was about 20mins away, However the Hotel does provide a shuttle service, If getting a taxi it's around £5.00. The hotel provides facilities for safety box in the back office of the reception. Overall realli good hotel, Dont get put off about the noise not really a big deal, by the time you get back at night your too tired to realise whats going on. Will be staying here in march 2008 If anyone wants to ask any questions you can email me. redrina_16@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Super budget hote, however...”
Reviews.Author: mello786
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Highland first week after Ramadan with my mum, gran and little sister! Upon arrival, our transfer guy was there on time to collect us (Shuttle bus), he carried our bags and was very polite and helpful. The hotel ride was about 15-20mins. On arrival at the hotel, our rooms were ready but not conjoining as we requested, we were told that a room next to mine would be availbale after two nights and they would move my mum n sister next to us but that didn't happen. We were given complimentary bottles of water and 'not complimentary' snacks, which we realised only when we checked out and received our bill...which taught us a lesson! First impression of the room was avergae (damp smell in bedroom which wore away but bathroom smell remained throughout our 6night stay), comfortable and clean but not completely accomodating. There was no clock or ironing facilities. Bathroom was average size, no complaints! The staff were very polite and hospitable- always ready to help- again no complaints! Breakfast is good- mostly the same verday though! Perfect location, easy to get taxis around! Fab juice shop next to the bus stop outside the hotel- I was hooked! A piece of advice for anyone tourists visiting Dubai- DON'T use the hotel to book excursions. They charge so much more, its a complete rip off! Always book them yourself in advance or while you are in Dubai- there are looooooads of tourism companies. Near the reception area- there is an Indian 'family' restaurant... uhhh I don't think so! I went with my family n we walked back out. 95% in there were men, old pervy types n the live entertainment was perfect for them....I'll leave you to judge! I requested the top level floor in the hotel by reading previous reviews about noise and believe me, I am happy I did! There is a club on the first floor and the noise can still be heard on the 7th floor- just not as bad. I wouldn't advise this hotel as being a family hotel at all- in the evening lots of men arrive at the hotel, looking for entertainment- at the same time, lots of 'lovely' females stroll in....again I leave you to be the judge! The rooftop pool is wonderful, small but nice. Sauna is okay- not bad! Overall, you get what you pay for from this hotel- nothing more and nothing less! Not a family hotel! More for couples and adults! Not child friendly! If you would like to ask me more question- email me at mello786@hotmail.com Mehreen

Reviews.Title: “Far better that it's two stars suggest!”
Reviews.Author: SugarPrincess777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 weeks during Ramadan and found it to be a wonderful hotel! The staff were friendly and helped us find all the best excursions and gave helpful advice on how best to get the most out of our stay in Dubai. Compared to Hotels in the UK with a similar star rating, this place was a palace! It's not luxurious, but it's clean and in a great location! Very easy to get a cab from outside the hotel (and in a city where cabs are a must, that was excellent!) I'm going back to Dubai next year and fully intend to stay there again! I would recommend it to anyone on a budget and staying in Dubai for a while!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the food”
Reviews.Author: Nayani
Reviews.Content: it is a great hotel and you must visit this hotel whenever you go to dubai .great food and great restarants.....very nice location specially the airport service is great.....................

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not as a 'family' hotel”
Reviews.Author: NHM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my wife & kids, despite booking almost a month in advance, they didn't have the executive suite ready on arrival and we had to settle for alternative rooms (this seemed a common problem as I overheard other guests complaining about the same issue). The rooms are clean and spacious and bathroom also very clean (we stayed on the 3rd floor). The reception area was average in size by Dubai standards. It was largely male dominated as the entrance to the 'dawat' club is through the recepion area and was frequented by men only. This was a bit of a nuisance if you have kids with you. The noise from this club could be heard on the 3rd floor till late night though it was only a muffled noise, not too bad. The breakfast was good with a quite a variety to choose from, the restaurant, I thought was expensive hence not very busy. Swimming pool and gym on the top floor/roof top was satisfactory. Access to the beach (Jumeira) and other shopping areas was reasonably easy via taxis though depending on the time some cab drivers refused to take us because of excessive traffic. Overall not a bad hotel but I wouldn't recommend it for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of pretty girls”
Reviews.Author: milanStanmore
Reviews.Content: Went to stay in the highland on a last minute business meeting, was impressed with the setup. Breakfast was a buffet, excellent news if you like a feast. Although situated in old dubai the area is pleasant with cabs available. The travel desk was very helpful and became a good friend. The club/bar in the hotel called dawat was very nice, lots of pretty girls dancing for your pleasure, if you like that sort of stuff this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: SilvanaLondon
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from 5 nights at the Highland Hotel. For the price we paid this hotel was excellent! The breakfast was lovely, buffet style with loads of choices and fresh fruit. The rooms were more than adequate for sleeping and showering in. I would not recommend EITHER of the two bars! One called Daawat is full of men getting cheap thrills from young girls dancing (ok if you like that kind of thing) and the other one called Rock City is empty and extortionate! We paid £16 for two vodka and lemonades! If you looking for a good night out walk two minutes down the road to the Palm Beach Club...great place! The hotel is in a good location, walkable distance to Meena Bazaar (great for cheap electricals) and short cab rides to Jumeirah Beach, Main Town Centre and all Shopping Mall. Cabs are easy to get from outside the hotel. Staff are brilliant. Only one thing, the Highland is located in "Old Dubai" so the local men STARE at any women (Although they are harmless!). There are not many women in the area. If this will freak you out, then it would be better to stay nearer Jumeirah beach where there are more tourists. Overall a safe place with a great taste of the real Dubai. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better...”
Reviews.Author: nz_kiwi33
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Highland through Emirates. I'm surprised they would have their name associated with this hotel. I read reviews and asked a week in advance for a room higher up and I was given a room on the third floor which was still very noisy, even my earplugs didn't drown out the noise. I found a few cockroches found in my bathroom too. The area wasn't the greatest my friends that live in Dubai were surprised I was staying in that area as it is known for brothels. Anyway I would book at pearl residences next time which was my original choice and it was a few $ cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good location 3star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ms_McLovinTravelling
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed here the last week in October and had a wonderful week. The hotel is in a good location and its 3stars are well deserved. We stayed up on the 6th floor so the noise from the nightclub was not really a problem for us. We went to the nightclub on our first night after arriving and it was our last time going there, it was a little seedy &I'd imagine if I wasn’t with my partner he would have gotten plenty of offers from all the Asian girls in there! The towels and the bed linen were changed every single day, which was great. The room was a good size with a massive king size bed. The usual TV fridge etc was also in the room; we had no problem getting an iron&ironing board from housekeeping when we needed them either. We also had the paper brought to us in our room a few mornings with breakfast. After the first morning we realised that it cost the same to have room service bring up your breakfast as it did to have it in the Coral Restaurant downstairs. So we opted to have it in our room most days. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff who were extremely polite &helpful especially the nighttime manager. Maybe they could actually teach a thing or two to workers in western hotels!! In relation to the phone in the hotel you can buy call cards in the shop up the road for 20 or 40 dirhams and use them on the hotel phone so all that you are charged is a few cent connection fee, I think it works out at about 20cent which is great! The staff at reception will explain how to use them but they are very easy&a great idea. The pool is quite small but ideal if u want to relax after a days sightseeing after all you hardly go to Dubai to sit at the pool all day!! Taxis can be hailed outside the hotel no problem and are very cheap to get around in. You really have no other choice but to use them. Jumeriah beach is about 15minutes away in taxi&costs on average 20dirhams(about€5). You can pay 5dirhams to get into the public Beach Park and is well worth it as it’s immaculately kept. So overall I would have no problem going back to this hotel or recommending it to family or friends as its a great 3star hotel. If your looking for 7star quality you’re better off staying at the Burj Al Arab but if your looking for a reasonably priced hotel in good location this is perfect!

HotelInfo.Name: Highland City Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Khaleed Bin Waleed street, Bur Dubai, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
